content.1: Thou also, son of man, take thee a tile, and lay it before thee, and pourtray upon it the city,
content.2: And lay siege against it, and build a fort against it, and cast a mount against it; set the camp also against it, and set
content.3: Moreover take thou unto thee an iron pan, and set it
content.4: Lie thou also upon thy left side, and lay the iniquity of the house of Israel upon it:
content.5: For I have laid upon thee the years of their iniquity, according to the number of the days, three hundred and ninety days: so shalt thou bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.
content.6: And when thou hast accomplished them, lie again on thy right side, and thou shalt bear the iniquity of the house of Judah forty days: I have appointed thee each day for a year.
content.7: Therefore thou shalt set thy face toward the siege of Jerusalem, and thine arm
content.8: And, behold, I will lay bands upon thee, and thou shalt not turn thee from one side to another, till thou hast ended the days of thy siege.
content.9: Take thou also unto thee wheat, and barley, and beans, and lentiles, and millet, and fitches, and put them in one vessel, and make thee bread thereof,
content.10: And thy meat which thou shalt eat
content.11: Thou shalt drink also water by measure, the sixth part of an hin: from time to time shalt thou drink.
content.15: Then he said unto me, Lo, I have given thee cow’s dung for man’s dung, and thou shalt prepare thy bread therewith.
content.16: Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, behold, I will break the staff of bread in Jerusalem: and they shall eat bread by weight, and with care; and they shall drink water by measure, and with astonishment:
content.17: That they may want bread and water, and be astonied one with another, and consume away for their iniquity.
